Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Clicks is giving out free sanitary pads, when in reality, customers who purchase three packs of selected sanitary pads get the cheapest one for free.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a single screenshot of a tweet and does not provide any additional evidence or sources to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tweet referring to free sanitary pads at Clicks is accurate without verifying the information or considering other possible explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the information may have been confused with a store promotion, as explained by Clicks SA on Twitter.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Clicks is not giving out free sanitary pads, but rather offering a promotion where customers can get the cheapest pack for free when purchasing three packs of selected sanitary pads.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
